word_mean: 索：一种形似柱状的解剖结构，有时特指脊髓灰柱。另见columna
用于支承和连接若干部件，并带有竖直导轨的直立柱状零件。
行，在网片纵向直线上排列的网目。一行网目由两行半目组成。
柱，主要承受轴向压力，用来支承上部结构并将荷载传至基础的竖向直杆。
在半潜式平台或坐底式平台上连接上部结构和下体或沉垫的柱形结构。

sentence.Network_cn: 她也定期为《泰晤士报高等教育增刊》写专栏文章。

sentence.Network_cn: 有消息说一队坦克已经出动了。

sentence.Network_en: I ghosted his weekly rugby column for the Telegraph.
sentence.Network_cn: 我为他代写《电讯报》每周的橄榄球专栏。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: partly from Old French columpne, reinforced by its source, Latin columna 'pillar'

entry.def: A column is a tall, often decorated cylinder of stone which is built to honour someone or forms part of a building.

example.ex: ...a London landmark, Nelson's Column in Trafalgar Square.
example.tran: 伦敦的标志性建筑，特拉法尔加广场上的纳尔逊将军纪念柱

entry.def: A column is something that has a tall narrow shape.

example.ex: The explosion sent a column of smoke thousands of feet into the air.
example.tran: 爆炸在空中形成了几千英尺高的烟柱。

entry.def: A column is a group of people or animals which moves in a long line.

example.ex: There were reports of columns of military vehicles appearing on the  streets.
example.tran: 有报道说几队军用车辆出现在街头。

entry.def: On a printed page such as a page of a dictionary, newspaper, or printed chart, a column is one of two or more vertical sections which are read downwards.

example.ex: We had stupidly been looking at the wrong column of figures...
example.tran: 我们稀里糊涂，看串了数字栏。

example.ex: In The Dictionary of Quotations, there are no fewer than one and a half columns devoted to 'kiss'.
example.tran: 在《引语词典》中，“亲吻”这一条目不下一栏半。

entry.def: In a newspaper or magazine, a column is a section that is always written by the same person or is always about the same topic.

example.ex: His name features frequently in the social columns of the tabloid newspapers...
example.tran: 他的名字频繁地出现在各种小报社会专栏的显著位置上。

example.ex: She also writes a regular column for the Times Educational Supplement.
example.tran: 她也定期为《泰晤士报高等教育增刊》写专栏文章。

means.word_mean: 1. a line of (usually military) units following one after another

2. a vertical glass tube used in column chromatography; a mixture is poured in the top and washed through a stationary substance where components of the mixture are adsorbed selectively to form colored bands
3. a linear array of numbers one above another
4. anything tall and thin approximating the shape of a column or tower;

sentences.sentence: "the test tube held a column of white powder"
"a tower of dust rose above the horizon"
"a thin pillar of smoke betrayed their campsite"

means.word_mean: 5. an article giving opinions or perspectives
6. a vertical structure standing alone and not supporting anything (as a monument or a column of air)
7. (architeture) a tall cylindrical vertical upright and used to support a structure

sentences.en: The dome was supported by white marble columns.
sentences.cn: 圆顶由白色大理石柱支撑着。

sentences.en: A column of soldiers marched down the highway.
sentences.cn: 一个士兵纵队沿着公路行进。

sentences.en: There are two columns on each page of this dictionary.
sentences.cn: 这本词典每一页有两栏。

sentences.en: I often read his column in the local paper.
sentences.cn: 我经常在当地的报纸上看到他的专栏文章。
